comments.creator: bugs@pettay.fi
comments.author: bugs@pettay.fi
comments.text: This might affect when and how to get rid of Attrs as Nodes.
comments.raw_text: This might affect when and how to get rid of Attrs as Nodes.

comments.creator: jonas@sicking.cc
comments.author: jonas@sicking.cc
comments.text:
In what sense does it affect how we get rid of attribute nodes?

Note that the xpath engine doesn't create attribute nodes when nodes are just used as part of an xpath expression, which is the perf critical part.

It only creates attribute nodes when they need to be returned as part of a result. But I don't think that's terribly perf critical. Nor do I think we can deprecate them entirely from xpath results. I.e. I think we should return the same thing as the objects you get if you iterate over an attribute-map.
comments.raw_text:
In what sense does it affect how we get rid of attribute nodes?

Note that the xpath engine doesn't create attribute nodes when nodes are just used as part of an xpath expression, which is the perf critical part.

It only creates attribute nodes when they need to be returned as part of a result. But I don't think that's terribly perf critical. Nor do I think we can deprecate them entirely from xpath results. I.e. I think we should return the same thing as the objects you get if you iterate over an attribute-map.
